TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IComPropertyBrowser

Docs.summary: Allows Visual Studio to communicate internally with the control.
Occurs when the control is browsing a COM object and the user renames the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only a change of value of the property that corresponds to DISPID_Name for the COM object raises the ComComponentNameChanged event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DropDownDone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes any open drop-down controls on the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool EnsurePendingChangesCommitted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Commits all pending changes to the control.
Docs.returns: if the successfully commits changes; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void HandleF4() cil managed

Docs.summary: Activates the control when the user chooses **Properties** for a control in Design view.
Gets a value indicating whether the control is currently setting one of the properties of its selected object.
Docs.value: if the control is currently setting one of the properties of its selected object; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadState(class Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey key) cil managed

Docs.param: The registry key that contains the user states.
Docs.summary: Loads user states from the registry into the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can save some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control states, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.HelpVisible%2A> properties, to the registry and load them the next time the user runs your application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveState(class Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey key) cil managed

Docs.param: The registry key that contains the user states.
Docs.summary: Saves user states from the control to the registry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can save some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control states, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.HelpVisible%2A> properties, to the registry and load them the next time the user runs your application.
